meanings.definition: The organization of different elements into a harmonious whole.
meanings.sent1: Good coordination is key in putting together a puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The coordination of colors in the painting was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The coordination of the dance troupe brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her coordination of flavors in the dish was like a symphony for the taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The coordination of the event made it a memorable experience for everyone.

meanings.definition: The ability to use different parts of the body together smoothly and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: His coordination in sports helped him score many goals.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's coordination was evident in her graceful movements.
meanings.sent3: The coordination of the acrobat was so precise, it looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her coordination on the balance beam was like watching a skilled tightrope walker.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's coordination was so fluid, it seemed effortless.

meanings.definition: The process of making different people or things work together effectively.
meanings.sent1: Teamwork requires good coordination among team members.
meanings.sent2: The coordination between the departments improved productivity.
meanings.sent3: The coordination of the volunteers made the event run smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His coordination in managing the project was like conducting an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The coordination between the actors made the play a success.
